text: goal {brandthis} quickly get started creating: _brand.yml file ggplot2 color scales palettes theming visualization needs. _brand.yml helps consistently theme rmarkdown, quarto, shiny products specifying colors, fonts, logos, information one file.

code: # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("durraniu/brandthis")

title: Create _brand.yml and ggplot2 goodies for personal or company branding
text: {brandthis} uses LLM APIs generating _brand.yml color palettes/scales. , need API key favourite LLM provider. can find supported APIs ellmer website. Grab API key (e.g., GOOGLE_API_KEY, OPENROUTER_API_KEY, etc.) put .Renviron file.

title: Create _brand.yml and ggplot2 goodies for personal or company branding
text: {brandthis} three main functions: brandthis::create_brand() creates _brand.yml personal company branding: brandthis::suggest_color_scales() suggests ggplot2 color scales palette colours similar color palette provided _brand.yml file. Suggestion made retrieving relevant info. knowledge store paletteer ggsci packages. knowledge store downloaded first time suggest_color_scales used: brandthis::create_color_palette() creates list discrete, sequential, diverging colour palettes colour palette provided _brand.yml:
code: # Provide your details in the prompt and optionally an image for extracting colors: personal_brand <- brandthis::create_brand(     prompt = "My name is John Doe.",     img = "https://free-images.com/md/e150/eugene_louis_boudin_venice.jpg",     type = "personal",     chat_fn = ellmer::chat_github ) # Provide multiple screenshots of company branding guidelines: company_brand <- brandthis::create_brand(   "Company name is Walmart",   img = c("walmart-font.png",           "walmart-palette.jpeg",           "walmart-logo.png"),   type = "company",   chat_fn = ellmer::chat_google_gemini ) suggested_scales <- brandthis::suggest_color_scales(personal_brand, "paletteer") color_palettes <- brandthis::create_color_palette(personal_brand)

title: Create _brand.yml and ggplot2 goodies for personal or company branding
text: {brandthis} comes shiny app lets generate _brand.yml color palettes benefit reviewing results app. can launch app running run_brand_app(): Demo createBranding app built brand.yml app available bslib can launched running shiny::runExample("brand.yml", package = "bslib").

title: Create _brand.yml — create_brand
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Create a personal _brand.yml with a local image personal_brand <- create_brand(   "My name is Katniss Everdeen",   browse = TRUE,   type = "personal",   chat_fn = ellmer::chat_github,   model = "gpt-4.1" )  # Create a personal _brand.yml with an image URL personal_brand <- create_brand(   "My name is Paul Blart",   img = "https://free-images.com/md/7687/blue_jay_bird_nature.jpg",   type = "personal",   chat_fn = ellmer::chat_google_gemini )  # If no info. is provided, you will be asked to provide some: brand_no_input <- create_brand(   "",   img = NULL,   type = "personal",   chat_fn = ellmer::chat_google_gemini ) # I can help with that! To create your personal # `_brand.yml` file, I'll need a bit more # information. Please provide the following: # # *   **Brand Name** (e.g., John Doe, or a short/full # name) and **Website(s)** (e.g., personal portfolio, # social media links) # *   **Brand Colors** or a **Color Palette** (e.g., # "I like blue, green, and a touch of orange," or # specific hex codes) # *   **Heading, Base, and Monospace Fonts** (e.g., # "I'd like Roboto for headings, Open Sans for base # text, and Fira Code for monospace," or you can ask # me to suggest some) # *   **Logo information** (e.g., "I have a logo at # this URL," or "I'd like a placeholder for now")  # Create a company _brand.yml with multiple image paths: company_brand <- create_brand(   "Company name is Walmart",   img = c("walmart-font.png",           "walmart-palette.jpeg",           "walmart-logo.png"),   type = "company",   chat_fn = ellmer::chat_google_gemini ) } # }
